DOC.detailed_description: The main objective study nutritional toxicological health risk evaluation among long-term vegan emphasis cumulative exposure pesticide . Main research method include : measurement food intake use three day food record , measurement nutritional toxicological bio-markers blood , serum plasma . Nutritional biomarkers include follow plasma/ serum measurement : concentration vitamin ( vitamin E , D2 , D3 , B12 beta-carotene ) , iron , iodine , selenium , fatty acid polyphenols . Toxicological measurement include nitrate , pesticides DNA-adducts . We recruit participant ( n = 41 ) advertisement publish Finnish Vegan Association 's monthly newspaper via online discussion forum . The selection criterion follow : participant ( 1 ) follow vegan diet least year , ( 2 ) 18 50 year age , ( 3 ) apparently healthy , ( 4 ) nonusers regular medication ( except oral contraceptive hormone replacement therapy ) . Further , match non-vegetarian participant age sex . The study approve Ethical Committee Kuopio University Hospital ( 69//2011 ) We assess consumption food baseline three-day food record use household measure . The participant receive instruction complete record , dietician check complete food record . The participant also fill health questionnaire inquire long-term healthy eating habit , include vitamin supplementation . We collect fast peripheral venous blood sample , plasma serum , store -70 Â°C analysis . Further , urine sample 24 hour collect prior phlebotomy divide aliquot . For one subject , spot urine sample available . We carry hematological chemical analysis laboratory ( hematological data ) , Helsinki University Central Hospital ( folate , vitamin B12 , vitamin D , homocysteine ) , National Institute Health Welfare ( alfa-tocopherol , beta-carotene , selenium , iodine , fatty acid profile , polyphenols ) . Nitrate , nitrite measure capillary electrophoresis DNA adduct ELISA Finnish Food Safety Authority .
